REMARK- Hearing was set for an initial appearance and an arraignment. Defendant Bryan David Mitchell was present. Court appointed the Federal Public Defenders office to represent the defendant. Defendant disrupted the proceedings. Court canceled the hearing. Hearing will be reset. Court instructed the USMS to provide a room where the defendant may participate by video. Defendant was remanded to the custody of the USMS. (ss) (Entered: 10/21/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Initial Appearance,arraignment as to Bryan David Mitchell held on 10/24/2008. Defendant present and in custody. Court asked counsel to have Mr. Mitchell to refrain from singing. Mr. Mitchell continued disrupting the proceedings. Court had the defendant removed from the courtroom and placed in an area where he was able to hear and see the proceedings. This was confirmed by Deputy Monks. Mr. Mitchell was also accompanied by counsel, Mr. Steele. Charging document read, rights and penalties explained. Court entered a plea of not guilty for the defendant. Court requested that any and all reports regarding the defendant be made available to court and the FPD office by 10/31/08. Government has until 10/31/08 to file their response to defendant's memorandum in opposition to the motion for a competency hearing. After reviewing the documents and briefs, Court will make a determination of whether to send the defendant for a competency evaluation. Pretrial Conference as to Bryan David Mitchell held on 10/24/2008. Discovery due by 11/7/2008, Motions due by 12/3/2008, Fourteen day Jury Trial set for 12/22/2008 08:30 AM before Judge Dale A. Kimball. Court set the matter for a status conference on 11/12/2008 at 10:00 AM before Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Attorney for Plaintiff: Brett Tolman, Richard Lambert, Dave Backman, Diana Hagen, Attorney for Defendant: Steve Killpack, Bob Steele, Parker Douglas, fpd. Court Reporter: Becky Janke. (ss) (Entered: 10/28/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Defendant present in custody with counsel. Defendant began singing during the proceedings. Court asked the defendant if he would sit quietly and listen to the proceedings. Counsel stated on the record that the defendant has been non responsive with them as well. Court ordered that Mr. Mitchell be removed from the courtroom and placed in an area where he will be able to see and hear the proceedings without disrupting them. Counsel for the defendant stated on the record that Mr. Steele will be present with the defendant during the proceedings. USMS confirmed that the defendant was now in the holding cell and was able to hear and see the proceedings. After hearing arguments from counsel, Court granted the 9 MOTION for Hearing To Determine the Mental Competency of Defendant filed by USA. Court ordered the defendant be sent, in the custody of the USMS, transferred to the Bureau of Prisons for an inpatient mental competency evaluation. Due to the defendant appearing on a writ from state custody the 22 MOTION for a detention hearing is moot. Defendant will remain in the custody of the USMS. Court ordered the government to prepare an order. Attorney for Plaintiff: Brett Tolman, Dave Backman, Diana Hagen, Richard Lambert, AUSA, Attorney for Defendant: Steve Killpack, Parker Douglas, Audrey James, Bob Steele, fpd. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Motion Hearing as to Brian David Mitchell held on 11/9/2009 re 79 SEALED MOTION filed by Brian David Mitchell, 69 Defendant's MOTION to Exclude the Introduction of all Lay Witness Testimony as Irrelevant, Unfairly Prejudicial and Cumulative filed by Brian David Mitchell, and 68 Defendant's MOTION to Exclude Expert Testimony and Objection to Introduction of Writings by Ervil LeBaron filed by Brian David Mitchell. Dft, in custody, was present with counsel. The Court advised the defendant of his constitutional right to be present if he does not disturb the proceedings by singing or any other behavior. Dft continued to sing and was ordered removed from the courtroom to another room where he was able to see and hear the proceedings. Dft's 69 Motion to Exclude Lay Witnesses was addressed. Mr. Steele asked the Court to defer ruling on the motion until the defense can respond in writing when the government's witness list is finalized. The government objected to additional briefing being filed at this late date. The Court would prefer to address the matter at this hearing but allowed the defense to submit additional briefing if it is necessary. The Court heard the arguments of counsel as to the other two motions before the Court, then took the motions under advisement. Attorney for Plaintiff: Brett Tolman, U.S. Attorney; Richard Lambert, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Voir Dire held on 11/1/2010 as to Brian David Mitchell. Court opened at 9:05 AM with all parties present. Mr. Steele made a record of dft's choice of clothing to be worn during trial; the Court ruled that there are security concerns with dft wearing robes so he will wear his prison garb, as he has chosen to do. The prospective jurors were brought into the courtroom and given the preliminary juror oath. The Court advised dft of his right to remain in the courtroom if he does not disrupt the proceedings; dft continued to sing and was ordered removed from the courtroom to another room where audio and video feed are available to him. Mr. Steele renewed dft's motion to hold the individual voir dire in chambers; the Court renewed it's prior ruling. Individual voir dire began. Eight jurors were stricken for cause; nine remain on the panel at the end of the day. Court recessed at 2:15 PM. Attorney for Plaintiff: Felice J. Viti, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, AFPD; Parker Douglas, AFPD; Wendy Lewis, AFPD; Audrey James, AFPD. Court Reporters: Kelly Hicken, Becky Janke, Laura Robinson. (kmj) (Entered: 11/01/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Voir Dire held on 11/2/2010 as to Brian David Mitchell. Court opened at 8:35 AM with all parties present. The dft was advised by the Court that he had the right to remain in the courtroom as long as he does not disrupt the proceedings; dft continued to sing and was removed from the courtroom. Voir dire continued. After the noon recess, the dft was again brought into the courtroom, admonished by the Court and removed when he continued to sing. Additional jurors were given the jury oath and participated in voir dire. At the conclusion of today's hearing, 5 potential jurors had been excused for cause and 13 were retained, making a total of 22 remaining for jury selection. Court recessed at 2:25 PM. Attorney for Plaintiff: Felice J. Viti, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, AFPD; Parker Douglas, AFPD; Wendy Lewis, AFPD; Audrey James, AFPD. Court Reporters: Kelly Hicken/Becky Janke/Laura Robinson. (kmj) (Entered: 11/02/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Voir Dire held on 11/3/2010 as to Brian David Mitchell. Court opened at 8:38 AM with all parties present. The dft was advised by the Court of his right to remain in the courtroom as long as he does not disrupt the proceedings; dft continued to sing and was removed to an annex in the courthouse. Thirteen potential jurors were given the oath; voir dire continued until 32 potential jurors remained in the pool for jury selection. The panel of 32 jurors will be contacted and directed to be present for jury duty on 11/4/2010 at 8:30 AM. Mr. Douglas moved to stay the proceedings while dft files a Writ of Mandamus and Motion for Stay with the 10th Circuit Court. Viti, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, AFPD; Parker Douglas, AFPD; Wendy Lewis, AFPD; Audrey James, AFPD. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Jury Trial as to Brian David Mitchell held on 11/4/2010. Court opened at 8:40 AM with all parties present. The dft was advised by the Court that he has the right to remain in the courtroom as long as he does not disturb the proceedings; dft continued to sing and was removed from the courtroom to an annex in the courthouse. The parties exercised their peremtory challenges on the 32 prospective jurors present in the courtroom; a panel of 12 jurors and 2 alternates was selected and sworn. Opening statements were made by Mr. Viti and Mr. Douglas. During Mr. Douglas' statements, the Court received notice that the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals had issued a temporary stay of the trial. The jury was excused and advised that they would be contacted by the Court when they were to return. Out of the jury's presence, the Court announced the ruling of the 10th Circuit Court. The Court ordered the trial recessed at 10:30 AM. Attorney for Plaintiff: Felice J. Viti, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, AFPD; Parker Douglas, AFPD; Wendy Lewis, AFPD; Audrey James, AFPD. Court Reporters: Ed Young, Kelly Hicken. (kmj) (Entered: 11/04/2010)

ORDER of USCA as to Brian David Mitchell(10-4197). Order filed by Judges Tacha, Tymkovich, and Holmes: Brian David Mitchell has filed a renewed petition seeking a writ of mandamus to compel the district court to transfer his case to another venue. We direct Mr. Mitchell and the government to file simultaneous briefs by 11:59 pm today (Mountain Standard Time) that (1) inform the court whether a jury has in fact been empaneled; and (2) if a jury has been empanled, what each party's position is on whether the petition for mandamus is moot. (jmr) (Entered: 11/04/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Jury Trial as to Brian David Mitchell held on 11/8/2010. Court opened at 8:38 AM with all parties present. Out of the jury's presence, Mr. Steele made a record that the defense did not pass the jury for cause, and also requested that the jury be asked if they had been approached by anyone during the stay of trial. The jury returned to the box and indicated that they had all avoided media coverage and had not been approached by anyone. The Court advised the dft that he has the right to be present if he does not disrupt the proceedings; dft continued to sing and was removed to an annex in the courthouse. Trial resumed. Mr. Douglas gave his opening statement. The govt's case began. Testimony of witnesses was heard and evidence received. Out of the jury's presence, during a recess, Mr. Steele invoked the witness exclusionary rule. The jury returned and trial continued with Ms. Hagen reading several stipulations into the record. Further testimony was taken. The jury was excused at 2:00 PM and instructed to return at 8:30 AM on 11/9/10. Court recessed. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Jury Trial as to Brian David Mitchell held on 11/16/2010. Court opened at 8:40 AM with all parties present. The Court advised the dft of his right to remain in the courtroom if he does not disrupt the proceedings; dft continued to sing and was removed to an annex in the courthouse. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Jury Trial as to Brian David Mitchell held on 11/30/2010. Court opened at 8:37 AM with all parties present. Out of the jury's presence, the Court addressed the issue raised yesterday pertaining to evidence of the state court finding of incompetency. The dft suffered a seizure prior to the jury coming into the courtroom. Court recessed while paramedics treated dft and transported him to the hospital. Court reopened; Mr. Viti and Mr. Steele advised the Court that the trial should not proceed today as the dft did not waive his right to participate in the trial prior to being taken to the hospital. The jury was brought into the courtroom. Judge Kimball read an instruction re: stipulations being entered into evidence, then excused the jury for the day. Court adjourned at 9:10 AM. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Jury Trial as to Brian David Mitchell held on 12/3/2010. Court opened at 8:38 AM with all parties present. Out of the jury's presence, Mr. Viti advised the Court that in order to finish the trial on time, the trial will need to be held for a few hours more each day. The Court will jettison its afternoon calendar and the trial will go until 5:00 PM or later each day, except on Tuesday, when court will adjourn at 4:00 PM. Dft's motion re: 404(b) evidence is denied for the reasons the Court stated on the record. The jury returned to the box. The Court advised the dft of his right to remain in the courtroom if he does not disrupt the proceedings; dft continued to sing and was removed from the courtroom to an annex in the courthouse. Trial resumed; testimony of witnesses was taken and evidence rec'd. The jury was excused at 2:25 PM with instructions to return at 8:30 AM on 12/6/2010. Court recessed. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Jury Trial as to Brian David Mitchell held on 12/9/2010. Court met with counsel in chambers at 8:35 AM. Court denied dft's motion to admit the entire Elizabeth Smart interview, except for the clips to be introduced today during Dr. Golding's testimony. Court found no problem with juror #2, so she will remain on the jury. Court opened at 8:40 AM with all parties present. The jury returned to the box. The Court advised the dft of his right to remain in the courtroom if he does not disrupt the proceedings; dft continued to sing and was removed to the annex in the courthouse. Trial resumed; testimony of govt rebuttal witnesses was completed. Govt rested. The defense rebuttal case was presented and dft' rested. Judge Kimball read the jury instructions to the jury. Closing arguments were made by Ms. Hagen, Mr. Steele, and Mr. Viti. The jury retired to deliberate at 5:35 PM. Jurors 13 and 14 were selected as the alternates and removed from the deliberation process but instructed to be on standby in case they were at some point required to replace a juror. At 8:20 PM the jury sent a note to Judge Kimball requesting a recess in the deliberations. The jury was excused and instructed to return at 8:30 AM on 12/10/10 to resume deliberations. Court adjourned. Attorney for Plaintiff: Felice J. Viti, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, AFPD; Parker Douglas, AFPD; Wendy Lewis, AFPD; Audrey James, AFPD. Court Reporters: Becky Janke, Kelly Hicken. (kmj) (Entered: 12/10/2010)
Jury Instructions as to Brian David Mitchell (jtj) (Entered: 12/10/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Jury Trial as to Brian David Mitchell held on 12/10/2010. The jury informed the Court at 10:30 AM that they had reached a verdict. The Court met with counsel in chambers at 10:45 AM. Mr. Steele requested the Court to query the jury members as to whether or not they were able to abide by the Court's instructions overnight. The Govt requested the Court to set a sentencing date, if necessary, in May; Mr. Steele had no objections. Court opened at 11:00 AM with all parties present. The Court inquired of the jury as to whether or not they were able to abide by the Court's instructions overnight; the jury indicated that they were. The verdict of guilty as to Counts 1 and 2 was published. The jury was polled, thanked and excused. Sentencing was set for 5/25/10 at 2:30 PM. Court recessed at 11:10 AM. Attorney for Plaintiff: Felice J. Viti, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, AFPD; Parker Douglas, AFPD; Wendy Lewis, AFPD. Probation Officer: Wendy White. Court Reporter: Kelly Hicken. (kmj) (Entered: 12/10/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Sentencing held on 5/25/2011 for Brian David Mitchell (1). As to Count(s) 1 and 2, Dft was found guilty by jury verdict. Dft's presence was waived by counsel for the argument portion of the hearing. The Court heard the arguments presented by Mr. Steele, Mr. Douglas and Mr. Viti as to the appropriate sentencing enhancements to be applied to the sentencing calculations. The dft, in custody, was then brought into the courtroom and seated with counsel. Victim statements were made by Mr. Ed Smart and Ms. Elizabeth Smart. Closing statement was made by Mr. Viti; the defense waived further comment. Dft, through counsel, waived his right to address the Court. The Court made its rulings on the record. The Court found that in addition to the calculations and enhancements applied in the Presentence Reprt, the enhancement for obstruction of justice applied to both counts and the enhancement for vulnerable victim applied to Count 2. The Court also found it was appropriate to apply an upward departure for extreme conduct, departing upward to total offense level 48. The Court imposed a sentence of life under the sentencing guideline range and under 18 U.S.C. § 3353a factors. SENTENCE: dft is committed to the custody of BOP for life. No term of Supervised Release is imposed. The dft shall give a DNA sample while in custody and shall register as a sex offender in whatever state he resides in. No fine. $200 SPA. The Court advised dft of his appeal rights. The Court will recommend that dft be placed in a federal correctional institution where he will receive the appropriate medical treatment. Attorney for Plaintiff: Felice J. Viti, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, AFPD; Parker Douglas, AFPD; Audrey James, AFPD; Wendy Lewis, AFPD. Probation Officer: Wendy White. Court Reporter: Kelly Hicken. (kmj) (Entered: 05/26/2011)
